attributes.action: allow students to claim local housing allowance.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
At present, the maximum student loan available to students recieving no other support is £4510. 

As the government claims this money is sufficient to support students for 12 months, (reducing the entitlement accordingly in the final year) full-time students are not permitted to claim any other benefits.

Over a 12 month period, it is easy for rent to absorb say, £3500 of this money, leaving students with only £20 per week to live on. This is less than half of what someone would get if they were receiving JSA and housing benefit/LHA.

Students work hard and make sacrifices in an attempt to gain qualifications that will make them useful members of their community, so why does the government feel it is acceptable to offer them less support than somebody who for whatever reason, does nothing at all to earn their money?
